char.charAt(int): returns the char value at the specified index.

int.compareToIgnoreCase(String): compares two strings lexicographically., ignoring case differences.
int.indexOf(String, int): returns the index of the first occurrence of String starting at int.
int.lastIndexOf(String, int): returns the index of the last occurrence of the String, searching backward from int.
int.length(): returns the number of characters in this string.

String.replaceAll(String, String): replaces all occurrences of the first String with the second.
String.substring(int, int): returns a new string from the first int to second.
String.toLowerCase(): converts all of the characters to lower case.
String.toUpperCase(): same as above, but to upper case.
String.trim(): returns a copy of the string, with leading and trailing whitespace omitted.

String[].split(String): returns an array of strings computed by splitting String.

boolean.contains(String): returns true if this contains String.
boolean.equalsIgnoreCase(String): returns true if this and String contain the same characters, ignoring case considerations.
boolean.startsWith(String): returns true if this contains String characters at the start.
boolean.endsWith(String): same as above but at the end.
